item.title: Pump Low Pressure Indication Systems – Demand Pump Pressure Switches

numlitem.para: Associated system pressure indication is operative,
Associated pump is operative before each departure, and
Associated engine driven pump indication system is operative.

placard.para: Placard the affected DEMAND Pressure switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Check affected pump operation as follows:

caution.para: DO NOT OPERATE PUMPS FOR MORE THAN 15 MINUTES WITHOUT MINIMUM QUANTITIES IN FUEL TANKS DUE TO POSSIBLE PUMP OVERHEAT.

numlitem.para: Air Driven Pump (ADP) or AC Motor-Driven Pump (ACMP):
Ensure that personnel are clear of flight controls.
With electrical power on aircraft, and pneumatic manifold pressurized, turn HYD PUMPS DEMAND switch to AUTO or ON.
System hydraulic pressure display on EICAS must read between 2800-3200 psig.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.
